page.title: 09History of Earls Croome.
page.content: The history of the Village is shared with Upton but it had its own annual Fair with merchandise unloaded from a quay one mile up river then carried by pack ass up the old Hollowstreet or way called Donkey Lane to Woodleys Farm, site of the Fair. There is little of historic note in the village apart from{Earls Croome Court,}house of Earl Coventry,an early 17th century house, and the small 12th century Church of St. Nicholas. The Tower was added in 1832. Within the chancel there is a stone memorial to Thomas Jeffry onetime owner of the Court and brother of the infamous Judge Jeffry.
